selected_quotes: Risk of Depression in Women with Psoriasis: A Cohort
#Psoriasis Linked to Higher Risk of #Depression in #Women #mentalhealth

citation.abstract:
Psoriasis is a common, chronic, and inflammatory disease of the skin, which has been associated with depression in cross-sectional studies with limited adjustment for confounders.
In this prospective cohort study, we investigated the risk of incident depression among individuals with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis (PsA).
We included 50,750 US female nurses from the Nurses' Health Study (NHS) who were free of depression at baseline in 2000. Those participants who ever self-reported clinician-diagnosed depression, regular use of antidepressants, or had a Mental Health Inventory (MHI) score of 52 or less were excluded. In 2008, we retrospectively asked participants if they had ever received a physician diagnosis of psoriasis or PsA. We defined depression as self-report of clinician-diagnosed depression or regular use of anti-depressant medication. Time-dependent Cox proportional hazard models were used to estimate age and multivariate-adjusted relative risks (RRs) of clinical depression.
After adjusting for covariates including body mass index (BMI), physical activity, smoking, and the presence of major chronic conditions, the multivariate-adjusted RR of clinical depression was 1.29 (95% confidence interval (CI): 1.10, 1.52) for women with psoriasis and 1.52 (95% CI: 1.06, 2.19) for women with psoriasis and concomitant PsA, compared to women without psoriasis.
We found an increased risk of depression in US females with psoriasis compared to those without psoriasis. This risk was higher in those who reported concomitant PsA. Future studies are needed to confirm these findings in other populations and to identify pathophysiological mechanisms linking psoriasis to depression. This article is protected by copyright. All rights reserved.
citation.title: Risk of Depression in Women with Psoriasis: A Cohort Study

blogs.title: Depressionsrisiko bei Psoriasis
blogs.summary: Frauen mit Psoriasis haben laut einer im British Journal of Dermatology veröffentlichten Studie ein erhöhtes Risiko, eine Depression zu entwickeln.

news.title: Higher Risk for Depression With Psoriasis
news.summary: (HealthDay News) -- There is an increased risk of depression among women with psoriasis, according to a study published online July 17 in the British Journal of Dermatology.

news.title: Schuppenflechte – nicht nur ein Hautproblem: Neue Medikamente helfen bei entzündeten Gelenken

news.title: Neue Medikamente helfen bei entzündeten Gelenken
news.summary: Bei vielen Patienten mit Schuppenflechte beschränkt sich die chronische Krankheit nicht auf die Haut. Was die wenigsten wissen: Die Entzündung kann sich auch auf die Gelenke ausweiten.

news.title: Höheres Risiko : Psoriasis macht depressiv
news.summary: Frauen mit einer Psoriasis haben ein deutlich erhöhtes Depressionsrisiko - vor allem, wenn sie zusätzlich noch an einer Psoriasisarthritis leiden.

news.title: Higher risk for depression with psoriasis
news.summary: (HealthDay)—There is an increased risk of depression among women with psoriasis, according to a study published online July 17 in the British Journal of Dermatology.
